title-group.article-title: China and the Arab Awakening: The Cost of Doing Business

contrib-group.aff: Assistant Professor, American University, Washington, DC and Director, Middle East-Asia Project (MAP), Middle East Institute, Washington, DC

article-meta.issue-title: Special Issue: China and the Middle East

abstract.p: The popular unrest that has swept the Arab World since January 2011—occurring as China entered a period of leadership succession and delicate economic adjustment—presented Beijing with both domestic political and diplomatic challenges. This article examines how, and how well, China responded to the Arab Awakening at home and in the conduct of its diplomacy.
